column4: I've uploaded an .ogv file and setup JWplayer on my site. When I view it in Chromium, it works just fine. If I view it in Firefox, however, it says there was an error, or it couldn't find the file. I've had multiple people on Windows tries it, too... none of them had it working. The link  is as follows: http://jyrangames.com/VideoTutorials/UnderstandingLOGL_GLib.h
I'm sorry. This is the appropriate link: http://jyrangames.com/VideoTutorials/UnderstandingLOGL_GLib.html
You can use mplayer or vlc.  (I prefer mplayer). Tell your windows users to try vlc.
So you recommend just ditching JWPlayer?
Or gxine... but that one.. I dono, I can't even get it to come up in gxine.  So I dono...
Alright. Thanks for the suggestions.
Oh I don't know.  I don't even know what JWPlayer is.  Never used it.
You're going to have to ask someone else about this one.   I'm not able to access it at all.
Is this a video that YOU are trying to share?
It's my video that I've uploaded onto my website, yes.
How long of a video is it?  (Time wize)?
18 min
Why don't you just share it via youtube?
You can embed it from youtube on your website
Time constraints + quality.
Like this:  http://trryhend.startlogic.com/   (Just an example)
Here is the way david miller does it, (maybe you can get a clue from his usage). See:  http://dave.frop.net/introduction_drupal_screencast
Firefox supports ogv
Does that work for you? http://jyrangames.com/VideoTutorials/UnderstandingLOGL_GLib.html
Nope.  Just shows a green box in the upper left corner.
Here is a portion of the code from Dave's page:  http://pastebin.com/czRY4xQq
I've the same exact code now (trying it without JWPlayer) and it still works in Chromium, but not in FF.
